solution_line_template: Ian is able to earn ${hourly_earning} per hour doing surveys. If he worked {hours_worked} hours doing surveys, then he earned ${hourly_earning}*{hours_worked} = $<<{hourly_earning}*{hours_worked}={total_earned}>>{total_earned}
If he spent half of what he earned, then he spent ${total_earned} * {percent_spent_num}% = $<<{total_earned}*{percent_spent_num}*{percent_factor}={amount_spent}>>{amount_spent}
If Ian spent ${amount_spent} of his earnings, then he has ${total_earned} - ${amount_spent} = $<<{amount_spent}={amount_spent}>>{amount_spent} left
